title: Support isPropSet for table config
body:
This fixes a bug introduced by #1008 which attempted to call isPropSet
for a table config object.  Table config did not implement that method
before this change.

title: Simplified option parsing
body: * Removed setters in ClientOpts

title: Use appropriate types to prevent casting
body:
Also use lambdas and computeIfAbsent with these types while I was in the area.

These changes should fix 3 java/abstract-to-concrete-cast alerts from lgtm.

title: Make max walogs a tserver property
body:
After the changes in #860 having a tablet property for max write ahead
logs no longer makes sense.  This should be a tserver property because
the behavior controls the max walogs per tserver.  This commit replaces
the table property with a tablet server property.

title: Fix #949 handle WAL failure to prevent stuck Accumulo
Add deprecated methods back with trivial default impl
Fix implicit casts of numbers & int multiplication
body: * Cast or replace with appropriate type to prevent overflow or data loss

title: Simplified options in ClientOpts
body:
* Updated ITs given changes
* Added -o option to allow properties to be overriden
* Remove ContextOpts

title: fixes #998 handle splitting tablet with no data and files
Create MapCounterInt for counting integers
body:
Created MapCounterInt as possible fix to [this](https://lgtm.com/projects/g/apache/accumulo/snapshot/7a9a5f6b26c77a59a9a195b9ea29355f7f6f2a1e/files/server/tserver/src/main/java/org/apache/accumulo/tserver/TabletServer.java?sort=name&dir=ASC&mode=heatmap#x2f5b87141746ce7c:1) at line 3209 and [this](https://lgtm.com/projects/g/apache/accumulo/snapshot/7a9a5f6b26c77a59a9a195b9ea29355f7f6f2a1e/files/server/base/src/main/java/org/apache/accumulo/server/master/balancer/GroupBalancer.java?sort=name&dir=ASC&mode=heatmap#xc3a19e02e617cd65:1)

This seemed like the conservative option, instead of changing the integers to longs in the thrift class, [Compacting](https://github.com/apache/accumulo/blob/692fec6494a8348517aea469fb95563700ab7557/core/src/main/java/org/apache/accumulo/core/master/thrift/Compacting.java#L36) but that is another option.

title: Remove c-style array declarations
body:
* While valid, c-style arrays make the code harder read
* Code was converted by IDE (not by hand)

title: Remove BatchWriterOpts and ScannerOpts
body:
* These options can now be configured when
  AccumuloClient is created

title: Fix code quality alerts found by lgtm
body:
* Add check and Test to prevent Array out of bounds in ByteUtils
* Add Out of bound check to ColumnSet and ColumnVisibility
* Remove unused js variable
* Suppress lgtm alert

title: Avoid multiple threads loading same cache block
body:
These changes update 1.9 to have similar functionality to 2.0 for cache loading.  With this change when multiple threads attempt to load the same block into cache only one thread will do the work.  The other threads will wait for the load.

I ran some performance test with 32 threads trying to load the same bock at the same time for 1000 times.  With the changes the test took 16.4 seconds.  Without these changes it took 31.0 seconds.

title: Split IteratorUtil up into 2 non-API classes
body:
* Moved methods not useful to users to non-API classes
* Created IterConfigUtil and SystemIteratorUtil for internal use
* Cleaned up loadIterators methods and created IterLoad class to assist

I could have put the source iterator and classCache objects into IterLoad but this introduced generics to the class.  I was also thinking of writing IterConfigUtil in a way to not have any generics.

title: Use try-with-resources for BatchWriter
body: * No need to pass in default BatchWriterConfig

title: Simplify CreateInitialSplitsIT
body: * Reduce duplicate code

title: Fix code quality issues
body:
* Fix if statement that is always true
* Remove resource leak

title: Add logging for slow file permits requests. (#978)
Fix JavaScript code quality issues
body:
* Removed unused variables
* Use delete only on properties
* Use === for string comparison

I ran Accumulo using Uno and the monitor worked fine after these changes.

title: Fixed more lgtm warnings
body:
* Use primitive types if variable defined with a boxed/wrapper
  type is never null

title: Fix more lgtm.com warnings
body:
* Remove synchronized from getAuthorizations() in ScannerOptions
* Added synchronized to methods that override a sychonrized method
* Stop overriding Thread.start() in Proxy

title: fixes #768 fix race condition in generation of table map
Support dispatching and prioritizing by user scan types
body:
While working on apache/fluo#1055 I found it cumbersome to configure
Fluo and Accumulo to dispatch Fluo notification scans to a dedicated
executor.  With these changes its much simpler to do that.  Fluo can
set an execution hint  like `scan_type=fluo-ntfy` and Accumulo can be
configured to execute the scan based on the type without changing Fluo
config or source code.

Before these changes, Fluo would have required either a custom
dispatcher or custom Fluo config for Accumulo executors. With these
changes nothing needs to be done in Fluo.

title: Fix BulkFileIT
body:
* Added future get() calls
* Future should not return failures

Originally broken by https://github.com/apache/accumulo/commit/010d0c819194944c8d5e3201f3b82a629778bda3

title: Fix race condition in Tables. Closes #768
body: This basically reverts the extra cacheing of the ZooCache that was added in 1.9.

  to get Accumulo to build using Java 11.
* Added depedencies that are no longer included by JVM in Java 11

title: Deprecate getConfig in IteratorEnvironment. Closes #954
body:
I added a getServiceEnv as a replacement but I am not sure we need it.  The only other place AccumuloConfiguration is used in core.iterators package is IteratorUtil and DeletetingIterator.  The only implementation left of getConfig is in o.a.a.core.clientImpl.OfflineIterator which has a ClientContext.

* Also give all methods in IteratorEnvironment default impls allowing
the removal of BaseIteratorEnvironment
* Remove unused references to AccumuloConfiguration in iterators
* Remove duplicate method implementations

title: Fixes #927 - Added 'Clear Logs' link on Recent Logs page
body: Issue 927 -  Can not clear logs on monitor in 2.0.0-alpha-2 #927

title: Move TableId and NamespaceId to public API
body:
* Move TableId and NamespaceId to public API package for use in SPI and
elsewhere, as needed.
* Retain AbstractId (in public API) for common implementation, and
because our internal namespace/table locking mechanism and unique ID
generation is agnostic to the specific ID type.
* Consolidate some constants for built-in tables/namespaces.
* Shorten/simplify/reduce API method names.

title: Simplify how classpath is built for MiniAccumuloCluster
Upgrade process should not assume the administrative user is named 'root'.
body:
When Accumulo is configured to use Kerberos for client authentication the
administrative user is configured at security initialization. Before this
change the upgrade process would attempt to grant access to the system
namespace to the 'root' user rather than to the configured administrative
user.

title: Changes to make 2.0 API more backward compatible
Support running MiniAccumuloCluster using Java 11
body: See https://github.com/apache/accumulo-website/issues/147

title: Avoid exposing internal types in new VolumeChooser SPIs
body:
For 2.0.0 new method were added to VolumeChooser that expose internal
types like ServerContext.  These types are very unstable and will
likely change alot in the future as we seek to remove static state
in Accumulo.  This PR introduces a simple SPI interface that exposes
some of the functionality of ServerContext in a more stable way.

title: Add ScannerBase.fetchColumn/Family using CharSequence

title: Add default impl for new method in ScannerBase
Merged multiple compaction strategies into one.
body:
While testing 2.0.0-alpha-2 I found that I wanted the functionality of
the size limit and two tier compactions strategies. However could only
configure one.  This PR merges those two into one.  Two tier can be
dropped because it is new in 2.0.0.

I fixed my master branch,  re-branched to accumulo-810_ and made my changes from a few weeks over again but also ran 'mvn test' this time to see which other classes used LogWriter.  I mistakenly thought the compiler would tell me which test classes used it so I broke the build last time.  I apologize.

title: Revert core/mapred* serialization
body:
* Fix broken core/mapred* ITs
* Revert serialization to previous (1.9) serialization in core

configuration for constructing client

deprecated types (remove unnecessary deprecation of internal
configurator classes)

title: Refactor FATE AdminUtil spliting getStatus method.
body:
Refactor AdminUtil to provide refactor the existing fate status methods into two - one that provides the existing behaviour and a second
that does not need to process lock information when that information is not required. This refactoring is a step to providing FATE metrics
where a count of existing FATES does not need the lock information.
* Adds unit test
* Includes code analysis clean-up.

title: Organize new Bulk Import code
body:
My attempt to make the new code easier to follow and maintain. 

* Move bulk import clientImpl code to its own bulk package
* Pull some FaTE logic out of BulkImport
* Made the LoadMappingIterator its own class and push some of the reader logic into it
* Added comments to BulkSerialize
* Removed some VisibileForTesting annotations from ConcurrentKeyExtentCache where its used in BulkImport
* Pulled some logic out of LoadFiles.loadFiles and created some new methods for readability

title: fixes #736 avoid dropping exceptions in scanner
body: In addition to cleaning up the exception handling I also switched from a background thread putting a batch of mutations on a queue to using a future.  Doing this made the code simpler making it easier to clean up the exception handling.

title: Fix #885 Simplify 'accumulo classpath' command
body: * Remove Java implementation and echo CLASSPATH variable

title: Clean up new Map Reduce internals
body:
Separated into 3 commits.
1 - Clean up the Input Classes by making AbstractRecordReader into AccumuloRecordReader
2 - Clean up the Output Classes by making AbstractRecordWriter into AccumuloRecordWriter
3 - Clean up FileOutput classes

AccumuloRecordReader and AccumuloRecordWriter are still abstract but I thought the names would make what gets serialized and logged more user friendly.

title: During tablet recovery filter logs out that do not define tablet.
body:
In a situation where a tablet had lots of write ahead logs, log
recovery consumed a lot of memory.  The reason for the memory
consumption was that all recovery logs are opened at once.  This
means the index for each file and a few key/values from each file
are read into memory.

This patch modifies the code to first open logs one at time to see if
they define the tablet. Then only the logs that define the tablet are
opened at the same time.  This has the potential to use less memory
when a subset of the logs define a tablet.

title: Make new Bulk Import tableTime take boolean
body:
* Also add new test to BulkLoadIT for tableTime

The fluent API for the new Bulk Import has an option to set the time on bulk import:
   ` c.tableOperations().importDirectory(dir).to(tableName).tableTime().load();`

But this can be awkward if you have a boolean in your code to set the time so making it take a boolean seems less awkward:
`    c.tableOperations().importDirectory(dir).to(tableName).tableTime(setTime).load();
`

expected parameter for verifying shortened keys

title: Check transaction are alive for new bulk import RPCs
Remove unused code in master and server
Make replication services start when configured
body:
* Only start the replication services in TabletServer if the required
properties are set at startup

I noticed tserver will always start multiple threads for replication, even if replication name is not configured.  As far as I can tell, this is the only required property for replication and if it is not set at startup anyway, there is a good chance not all data will be replicated.

title: Fix race condition when getting WALs for dead tserver
body:
When a tablet server dies the master gets its WALs from ZK.  In ZK there
is a list of WALs per tserver. Each WAL in ZK has state that is either
OPEN, CLOSED, or UNREFERENCED.  The master needs a list of OPEN and
CLOSED logs for dead tservers.  While the master is trying to obtain
this list its possible that the Accumulo GC may delete an UNREFERENCED
WAL.  If this happened then the code before this commit would return an
empty list of WALs. This could result in OPEN and CLOSED logs being
ignored for recovery which could result in data loss.  This patch fixes
the race condition.

This bug was observed while looking into an exception I noticed while
writing test for #860.  In the IT I was frequently calling another
WalStateManager function and noticed NoNodeExceptions.  As a result I
examined how the entire class handled NoNode race conditions and found
this bug.  I noticed some other possible NoNode race condition, but do
not think this these would occur with the current way the code is called.

labels.name: blocker
labels.description: This issue blocks any release version labeled on it.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: This issue has been verified to be a bug.

title: Use double brackets for bash conditionals
